answers.label: Moderate unexplained weight loss (Less than 10% of presumed or measured body weight)
Minor mucocutaneous manifestations (seborrheic dermatitis, papular pruritic eruptions,fungal nail infections, recurrent oral ulcerations, angular cheilitis)
Recurrent upper respiratory tract infections(sinusitis, tonsillitis, bronchitis, otitis media,pharyngitis)
Unexplained severe weight loss (over 10% of presumed or measured body weight)
Unexplained chronic diarrhoea for longer than one month
Unexplained persistent fever (intermittent or constant for longer than one month)
Severe bacterial infections (e.g. pneumonia, empyema, pyomyositis, bone or joint infection,meningitis, bacteraemia)
Acute necrotizing ulcerative stomatitis, gingivitis or periodontitis
Unexplained anaemia (below 8 g/dl),neutropenia(below 0.5 x 109/l) and/orchronic thrombocytopenia(below 50 x109/l)
Recurrent severe bacterial pneumonia (Equal or more than 2 episodes within 1 year)
Chronic orolabial, genital or ano-rectal herpes simplex infection for more than 1 month
Extra pulmonary tuberculosis (EPTB) Conditions where confirmatory diagnostic testing is necessary
Cryptosporidiosis, with diarrhoea for more than 1 month
Cytomegalovirus (CMV) retinitis or infection of the organs (other than liver, spleen,or lymph nodes)
Candidiasis of the oesophagus or airways
Lymphoma cerebral or B cell Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma
Symptomatic HIV-associated nephropathy or HIV associated cardiomyopathy
Extensive HPV or molluscum infection (More than 5% of body area or face)
Recurrent oral ulcerations (More than 2 episodes in 6 months)
Herpes zoster (More than 1 episode in 12 months
Recurrent or chronic upper respiratory infection(URI): otitis media, otorrhoea,sinusitis (More than 2 episodes in 6months)
Unexplained moderate malnutrition (- 2SD or Z score) not responding to standard therapy
Unexplained persistent fever (intermittent or constant more than 1 month)
Severe recurrent presumed bacterial pneumonia (More than 2 episodes in 12 months)
Acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis or periodontitisParotid enlargement
Unexplained anaemia (More than 8g/dL), neutropenia (Less than 1,000/mm ) or thrombocytopenia (More than 30,000 per mm 31 for more than 1 month
Recurrent or chronic upper respiratory infection(URI): otitis media, otorrhoea, sinusitis (More than 2 episodes in 6months)
Unexplained severe wasting or severe malnutrition (-3 SD or Z score) not responding to standard therapy
Recurrent severe bacterial infections (More than 2 episodes in 12 months, excluding pneumonia)
Chronic orolabial or cutaneous HSV (lasting more than 1 month)
Cryptosporidiosis or Isosporiasis (with diarrhoea for more than 1 month)
CMV infection of organ other than liver, spleen, lymph nodes (and onset age more than l month)
Disseminated mycobacterial disease other than tuberculosis
Candida of trachea, bronchi or lungs
